<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/01/goldman-sachs-google-amazon-prepare-return-office?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Before We Move Forward, CEOs Want to Go Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/01/goldman-sachs-google-amazon-prepare-return-office" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of an upholstered blue couch with an old computer and keyboard sitting on it. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTk3L3dmaC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dust off your daily podcast of choice, because an old friend is waiting to welcome you back: the commute. In the last week...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Google said it’s </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/31/google-speeds-partial-office-reopening-and-puts-limits-on-remote-work.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moving up</a></span><span> reopening plans and allowing workers to return in a limited capacity this month. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Goldman Sachs told summer interns they're </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-29/goldman-sachs-says-summer-interns-will-work-from-its-offices?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">headed</a></span><span> to TriBeCa.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Wells Fargo told employees </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wells-fargo-plans-to-bring-employees-back-to-the-office-in-september-11617133597?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it's eyeing</a></span><span> a return after Labor Day.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Amazon said it's </span><span><a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/amazon-return-to-office-covid-19-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bringing</a></span><span> Seattle HQ employees back in time for sweater weather. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Companies are going full Prius</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As offices reopen, many firms are embracing "hybrid" arrangements where employees only come in a few days a week. Which is apparently what they crave: A Microsoft survey of 30,000 workers found 73% want flexible remote options. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Microsoft itself is </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/3/22/22344273/microsoft-redmond-headquarters-open-hybrid-workplace?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">already allowing</a></span><span> some workers back, with part-time remote as the new standard. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser also plans on 3 days/week in the office for most employees after the pandemic.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why not go full remote? </strong>Some execs aren't convinced full-time remote work is better for the employee or the business. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/14/business/dealbook/satya-nadella-microsoft.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has warned</a> it causes burnout, and incoming Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said that with WFH, “You just don’t riff the same way,” which hurts innovation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, there are social effects to consider. Economist Enrico Moretti <a href="https://www.vox.com/22352360/remote-work-cities-housing-prices-work-from-home?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Vox</a> that "high-productivity" workers and specialized industries have always clustered in cities (think tech in Seattle, financial services in NYC, biotech in Boston). Moretti argues the pull of certain industries, packed bars, and Shawarma Guys is too strong for most people to work remote full-time in the long run. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Either way, prepare for office changes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As companies accommodate a partially remote workforce, they're <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/30/business/office-return-space.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reimagining</a> office spaces to include:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Larger meeting areas</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Zoom rooms" with lots of screens and cameras</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bringing back SMART Board glory days</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fewer personal desks, more "hoteling" workstations (aka hot desks)</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mobile furniture </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One thing to figure out? How to preserve the essential <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/youre-going-back-to-the-office-what-happens-to-your-nap-habit-11617030329?mod=e2tw&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">afternoon nap</a>. </p>

TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/01/budget-airlines-signify-boom-industry?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
McDonald's and a $17 Beer for Breakfast Is Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/01/budget-airlines-signify-boom-industry" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>

<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Larry David trying to put suitcase in overhead bin on airplane" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUOxeZc41DVT2l9laU/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Frontier Airlines <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/discount-airlines-tap-stock-market-as-investors-bet-on-travel-recovery-11617283861?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a> $570 million in an IPO yesterday, becoming the second budget airline (after Sun Country) to go public this year. Because if you thought IPOs were just for tech companies, you haven't heard the news: Air travel is becoming a more popular spring trend than florals, especially in vacation hotspots like Jackson Hole, WY.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> After losing about $35 billion last year, the airline industry says it's time to come get your Biscoffs and tiny Sprites. US airports have recorded nearly three weeks of 1+ million daily passengers, and American Airlines said <a href="https://www.nbcdfw.com/news/business/american-airlines-says-passengers-are-returning/2593322/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spring bookings</a> are at 90% of 2019 levels. Other airlines are also preparing for a hot girl summer:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Delta will </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/travel/delta-stop-blocking-middle-seats-may-1-n1262606?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stop blocking</a></span><span> middle seats on May 1 (sigh).</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>United told staff it </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/01/united-airlines-tells-staff-its-hiring-hundreds-of-pilots-next-month-as-carrier-plans-for-a-travel-recovery.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will hire</a></span><span> hundreds of pilots to keep up with increased demand, per CNBC.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But...</strong>while leisure travel may be returning, business travel is still trying to defrost with a broken hairdryer. And business passengers <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-20/u-s-airlines-face-the-end-of-business-travel-as-they-knew-it?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">account for</a> 60%–70% of industry sales, per the trade group Airlines for America.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MOVIES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/01/godzilla-vs-kong-opened-boom-netflix-bought-knives-series?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Money in Streams and Screens
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/01/godzilla-vs-kong-opened-boom-netflix-bought-knives-series" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Godzilla monster fighting King Kong" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjAzL2tvbmdfdnNfZ29kemlsbGEucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>WarnerBros</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's been a big week for anyone who loves monster movies or watching Daniel Craig snoop through rich people's things.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><em>Godzilla vs. Kong</em></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Warner Bros. and Legendary Entertainment's monster mash had the best opening day for the US film industry since the pandemic began, <a href="https://variety.com/2021/film/box-office/box-office-godzilla-vs-kong-debuts-to-solid-9-6-million-on-opening-day-1234942422/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collecting</a> $9.6 million at the domestic box office. That comes after a $123 million weekend overseas that <a href="https://deadline.com/2021/03/godzilla-vs-kong-opening-weekend-china-international-box-office-1234722557/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">broke</a> pandemic-era international box office records.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Side note: </strong>The film was also released on HBO Max for no extra cost to subscribers, but in a bullish sign for theaters, plenty of people still wanted to witness the two beefy boys battle it out on the big screen.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Speaking of beefy boys...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix <a href="https://variety.com/2021/film/news/netflix-buys-knives-out-sequels-450-million-1234941995/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shelled</a> out a mammoth $450 million for the rights to two more <em>Knives Out </em>movies. The first film from Lionsgate and MRC, an Agatha Christie-style murder mystery with everyone's favorite chunky knit sweater, earned $311+ million and an Oscar nomination for best original screenplay.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As more streaming services crowd consumers, Netflix has realized more seasons of <em>Love is Blind</em> just isn't enough to grow its subscriber base and sealed one of the biggest deals ever for the rights to a movie series.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s spring, daffodils are sprouting, the days are getting longer, and yet your student loans are still bumming you out. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s time to refresh your student loans with CommonBond. </strong><a href="https://www.commonbond.co/refinance-student-loan?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=refi-mktg-newsletter-mb-tof-20210402" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CommonBond can replace your old loans with a single, smarter one</a>. You can save money every month or pay off your debt more quickly—either way, your debt will go from ceiling stain-brown to the bright yellow hue of the bloomin’ beauties in your yard. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Though the daffodils are growing taller, <strong style="color:#000">CommonBond’s interest rates are as low as they’ve ever been</strong>. Rates are starting to rise, though, <a href="https://www.commonbond.co/refinance-student-loan?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=refi-mktg-newsletter-mb-tof-20210402" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">so now is the time</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While refinancing can be intimidating,<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>CommonBond’s award-winning CARE team can walk you through any questions via text, chat, email, or phone. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nature doesn’t get to hog all the refreshing—<a href="https://www.commonbond.co/refinance-student-loan?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=refi-mktg-newsletter-mb-tof-20210402" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">refresh your student loans with CommonBond</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>US manufacturing activity hit its <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy-manufacturing/u-s-manufacturing-sector-index-races-to-37-year-high-in-march-ism-idUSKBN2BO5RB?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest level</a> in 37 years last month. The biggest problem right now is the Peloton one—making products fast enough to satisfy all the demand.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"If the mailman stopped to kick every dog that barked at him, he'd never deliver the mail."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That's a classic saying from Roy Williams, the legendary UNC coach who <a href="https://www.espn.com/mens-college-basketball/story/_/id/31177433/north-carolina-tar-heels-basketball-coach-roy-williams-retires?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retired</a> yesterday after 33 seasons coaching college basketball. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> The guy who created istheshipstillstuck.com about the Ever Given explains what it was like to run a viral website. (<a href="https://notfunatparties.substack.com/p/inside-a-viral-website?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Not Fun at Parties</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/01/three-visions-rail-future-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fun With Train Maps
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Who doesn't spend their days dreaming of a bright future for American rail transportation? Here are three possible paths forward.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. After President Biden released his $2.3 trillion infrastructure plan yesterday, Amtrak <a href="https://www.axios.com/amtrak-map-biden-infrastructure-effddc6e-7767-4fb0-8ea2-1e6a1ae054da.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released a map</a> showing what it'd do with extra funds: 30+ new routes in 15 more states, serving 160 additional communities and 20 million more passengers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTk4L2FtdHJha19tYXAuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Amtrak</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;">2. This next map, created by graphic designer Alfred Twu in 2013, envisions a Captain America-style, high-speed rail network across the US. It's been tweeted by Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and has <a href="https://www.vox.com/2021/3/10/22303355/gen-z-high-speed-rail-biden-map-meme-buttigieg?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">become a meme</a> among Gen Z transportation geeks. It's not considered realistic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTk5L2hpZ2gtc3BlZWRfcmFpbF9tYXAucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Alfred Twu</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;">3. A more realistic vision for high-speed rail comes from transit researcher <a href="https://pedestrianobservations.com/2021/03/22/high-speed-rail-followup/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alon Levy</a>, who thinks more concentrated regional networks make the most sense.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjAwL21hcF9vZl9oaWdoLXNwZWVkX3JhaWwuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small><em>Queaugie</em></small></p>

after Labor Day.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAmazon said it's \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/amazon-return-to-office-covid-19-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCompanies are going full Prius\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs offices reopen, many firms are embracing \"hybrid\" arrangements where employees only come in a few days a week. Which is apparently what they crave: A Microsoft survey of 30,000 workers found 73% want flexible remote options. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMicrosoft itself is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/3/22/22344273/microsoft-redmond-headquarters-open-hybrid-workplace?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealready allowing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e some workers back, with part-time remote as the new standard. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCitigroup CEO Jane Fraser also plans on 3 days/week in the office for most employees after the pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy not go full remote? \u003c/strong\u003eSome execs aren't convinced full-time remote work is better for the employee or the business. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/14/business/dealbook/satya-nadella-microsoft.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas warned\u003c/a\u003e it causes burnout, and incoming Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said that with WFH, “You just don’t riff the same way,” which hurts innovation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, there are social effects to consider. Economist Enrico Moretti \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/22352360/remote-work-cities-housing-prices-work-from-home?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Vox\u003c/a\u003e that \"high-productivity\" workers and specialized industries have always clustered in cities (think tech in Seattle, financial services in NYC, biotech in Boston). Moretti argues the pull of certain industries, packed bars, and Shawarma Guys is too strong for most people to work remote full-time in the long run. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eEither way, prepare for office changes\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs companies accommodate a partially remote workforce, they're \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/30/business/office-return-space.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereimagining\u003c/a\u003e office spaces to include:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLarger meeting areas\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Zoom rooms\" with lots of screens and cameras\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBringing back SMART Board glory days\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFewer personal desks, more \"hoteling\" workstations (aka hot desks)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMobile furniture \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne thing to figure out? How to preserve the essential \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/youre-going-back-to-the-office-what-happens-to-your-nap-habit-11617030329?mod=e2tw\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eafternoon nap\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS (after Sun Country) to go public this year. Because if you thought IPOs were just for tech companies, you haven't heard the news: Air travel is becoming a more popular spring trend than florals, especially in vacation hotspots like Jackson Hole, WY.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e After losing about $35 billion last year, the airline industry says it's time to come get your Biscoffs and tiny Sprites. US airports have recorded nearly three weeks of 1+ million daily passengers, and American Airlines said \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcdfw.com/news/business/american-airlines-says-passengers-are-returning/2593322/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espring bookings\u003c/a\u003e are at 90% of 2019 levels. Other airlines are also preparing for a hot girl summer:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDelta will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/travel/delta-stop-blocking-middle-seats-may-1-n1262606?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estop blocking\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e middle seats on May 1 (sigh).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUnited told staff it \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/01/united-airlines-tells-staff-its-hiring-hundreds-of-pilots-next-month-as-carrier-plans-for-a-travel-recovery.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill hire\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e hundreds of pilots to keep up with increased demand, per CNBC.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut...\u003c/strong\u003ewhile leisure travel may be returning, business travel is still trying to defrost with a broken hairdryer. screenplay.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs more streaming services crowd consumers, Netflix has realized more seasons of \u003cem\u003eLove After President Biden released his $2.3 trillion infrastructure plan yesterday, Amtrak \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/amtrak-map-biden-infrastructure-effddc6e-7767-4fb0-8ea2-1e6a1ae054da.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased a map\u003c/a\u003e showing what it'd do with extra funds: 30+ new routes in 15 more states, serving 160 additional communities and 20 million more passengers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTk4L2FtdHJha19tYXAuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003eAmtrak\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e2. This next map, created by graphic designer Alfred Twu in 2013, envisions a Captain America-style, high-speed rail network across the US. It's been tweeted by Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and has \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2021/3/10/22303355/gen-z-high-speed-rail-biden-map-meme-buttigieg?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecome a meme\u003c/a\u003e among Gen Z transportation geeks. It's not considered realistic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTk5L2hpZ2gtc3BlZWRfcmFpbF9tYXAucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003eAlfred Twu\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e3.
